title: increment version to 0.5
message:
increment version to 0.5

Signed-off-by: Andrea Righi <andrea@betterlinux.com>

title: more realistic time left evaluation
message:
more realistic time left evaluation

Evaluate the time left only when a percentage point of the total battery
level changes.

Otherwise we end up to have very bad fluctuations in the time left
estimation: the measure of the battery level in percentage points is too
coarse grained, so we end up to have an estimation more close the real
value when the battery level changes and a too much optimistic when the
battery is actually discharging but the percentage point is not yet
changed.

Signed-off-by: Andrea Righi <andrea@betterlinux.com>

title: rewrite the time left evaluation heuristic
message:
rewrite the time left evaluation heuristic

Do not consider voltage at all when evaluting the depletion time of the
battery. It's just incorrect and it doesn't give realistic results.

Better to use the battery level, even if it's a bit slower, it should
gives more realistic results.

Signed-off-by: Andrea Righi <andrea@betterlinux.com>
